page.title: 16Fairfield Hospital
page.content: Fairfields Mental Hospital, originally called the Three Counties Asylum, built in 1859 takes patients from Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire and Cambridgeshire. It can accommodate over 9OO patients. In 1985 it had 65O patients, short and long term, ranging in anges from 17 to 92. There is a staff of 82O, 47O of which are medical, the rest being administrative, clerical and ancillary. The 1985 cost of running the Hospital were Â£7.5 million. The treatment the patients receive depends upon the seriousness and complication of their mental illness but great emphasis is placed on occupational therapy and if possible, encouraging patients to live a full, self sufficient life often in units where, under the care of a warden, they cater for themselves.
